intro: Trichogyne glomerata, commonly known as the clustered trichogyne, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, which includes a wide variety of orchids. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Trichogyne glomerata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its botanical significance lies in its unique floral structure and ecological role in supporting local insect pollinators.
